key_points: A note referencing the Oxford High School shooting was found at Memorial High School in Madison, Wisconsin.
The note was discovered on a bathroom floor during the afternoon.
Principal Matt Hendrickson and the Madison Metropolitan School District assured there is no security or safety risk.
An investigation is underway, involving the Madison Police Department and the Central Office of School Safety.
The school community is encouraged to share any concerning information to help maintain a safe environment.
On the same day, an 18-year-old student at La Follette High School in Madison was arrested for having a loaded gun inside the school.
The arrested student, identified as Marquan T. Webb, is facing several charges including possession of a stolen firearm.
The loaded gun found with Webb had been reported stolen out of Cottage Grove in September.
There were no injuries reported related to the discovery of the note or the arrest of Webb.
A trend of copycat threats has emerged following the Oxford High School shooting, leading to class cancellations in over a dozen Detroit school districts.
